title-group.article-title: Equal Moments Division of a Set

abstract.p: Let <tex-math>$N_q^* (m)$</tex-math> be the minimal positive integer N, for which there exists a splitting of the set [0, N -1] into q subsets, <tex-math>$S_0 ,S_1 ,...,S_{q - 1} ,$</tex-math> whose first m moments are equal. Similarly, let <tex-math>$m_q^* (N)$</tex-math> be the maximal positive integer m, such that there exists a splitting of [0, N -1] into q subsets whose first m moments are equal. For q = 2, these functions were investigated by several authors, and the values of <tex-math>$N_2^* (m)$</tex-math> and <tex-math>$m_2^* (N)$</tex-math> have been found for m ≤ 8 and N ≤ 167, respectively. In this paper, we deal with the problem for any prime q. We demonstrate our methods by finding <tex-math>$m_3^* (N)$</tex-math> for any N < 90 and <tex-math>$N_3^* (m)$</tex-math> for m ≤ 6.
